abstract.p: Litton Industries will build oil tanker for Phillips Petroleum Co in contract valued at $197 million (S)

block.p: LITTON INDUSTRIES INC., Woodland Hills, Calif., the third-largest shipbuilder for the United States Navy, said it would build an oil tanker for the Phillips Petroleum Co., Bartlesville, Okla., the sixth-largest oil company, valued at $197 million.

LITTON INDUSTRIES INC., Woodland Hills, Calif., the third-largest shipbuilder for the United States Navy, said it would build an oil tanker for the Phillips Petroleum Co., Bartlesville, Okla., the sixth-largest oil company, valued at $197 million.

LEVEL 3 COMMUNICATIONS INC., Broomfield, Colo., said it won a 20-year contract valued at more than $100 million to supply networking services to France Telecom S.A., Paris, the No. 2 telephone company in Europe.

SHOP AT HOME INC., Nashville, the third-largest home-shopping retailer in the United States, agreed to sell its television station, KZJL, Channel 61, in Houston to Liberman Broadcasting Inc., Burbank, Calif., for $57 million.

DAIMLERCHRYSLER A.G., Stuttgart, Germany, the No. 1 maker of commercial trucks in the world, said it completed a $583 million purchase of the Detroit Diesel Corp., Detroit, a former division of the General Motors Corp.
